notes_display: Rev. double strike; Silimar to the Schaaf collection. No. 316; however, the attendance crown are not those of Wahram IV, they wear the crown of Shapur III
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Shapur III on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three arcades, the latter enclosing lily-like object; covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below the korymbos, pointing upwards, pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing below ball of hair, pointing upwards, earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running the shoulders to the breast ornament (only upper part visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 5 h l. o.  Mzdysn [bgy šhpwhry] MRKAn MRKA ['ry'n W 'nyr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n]|  mazdēsn bay Šābuhr šāhān šāh Ērān ud Anērān kē čihr az yazdān|"The Mazda-worshiping divine Shapur, King of Kings of the Iranians and non-Iranians, whose seed (image|splendour) is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar slabs; above bust with diadem and elaborate coiffure to the right, surrounded by flames, depicted by vertical lines, to the left and right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Shapur III, holding a barsom with both hands, both figures facing inwards; dotted border
issue_references_s: SNS 3 Mint III Type Ib1/1b no. A13: 102
